description.value: A selection of DICOM SOP instances within a single Study and Series. This might include additional specifics such as a set of frames or an image region, allowing linkage to an Observation Resource.

short.value: A selection of DICOM SOP instances

definition.value: A selection of DICOM SOP instances within a single Study and Series. This might include additional specifics such as a set of frames or an image region, allowing linkage to an Observation Resource.

human.value: At least one of seriesUid or imageRegion3D SHALL be present
seriesUid SHALL only be present if studyUid is present
seriesNumber SHALL only be present if seriesUid is present
instance SHALL only be present if seriesUid is present
imageRegion3D SHALL only be present if frameOfReferenceUid is present
imageRegion3D SHALL only be present if instance.imageRegion2D is not present
if present, instance.imageRegion2D.coordinate SHALL have a value count that is a multiple of 2
if present, imageRegion3D.coordinate SHALL have a value count that is a multiple of 3
modality SHALL only be present if seriesUid is present
only one of instance.frameNumber, instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier, instance.segmentNumber, instance.regionOfInterest and instance.waveFormChannel SHALL be present

expression.value: (instance.frameNumber.exists() implies (instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier.exists() or instance.segmentNumber.exists() or instance.regionOfInterest.exists() or instance.waveFormChannel.exists()).not()) and (instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier.exists() implies (instance.frameNumber.exists() or instance.segmentNumber.exists() or instance.regionOfInterest.exists() or instance.waveFormChannel.exists()).not()) and (instance.segmentNumber.exists() implies (instance.frameNumber.exists() or instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier.exists() or instance.regionOfInterest.exists() or instance.waveFormChannel.exists()).not()) and (instance.regionOfInterest.exists() implies (instance.frameNumber.exists() or instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier.exists() or instance.segmentNumber.exists() or instance.waveFormChannel.exists()).not()) and (instance.waveFormChannel.exists() implies (instance.frameNumber.exists() or instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier.exists() or instance.segmentNumber.exists() or instance.regionOfInterest.exists()).not())

human.value: if present, instance.waveFormChannel SHALL have a value count that is a multiple of 2

definition.value: Business identifiers assigned to this imaging selection by the performer and/or other systems. These identifiers remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

comment.value: Note: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)). It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices MAY occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types. For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

requirements.value: Allows identification of the imaging selection as it is known by various participating systems and in a way that remains consistent across servers.

definition.value: The current state of the imaging selection. This is distinct from the status of any imaging study, service request, or task associated with the imaging selection.

comment.value: Unknown does not represent "other" - one of the defined statuses must apply. Unknown is used when the authoring system is not sure what the current status is.

isModifierReason.value: This element is labeled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource SHOULD NOT be treated as valid

definition.value: Classifies the general purpose of the imaging selection.

requirements.value: Used for filtering what imaging selections are retrieved and displayed.

definition.value: The distinct modality for this selected series. This MAY be either an acquisition modality (e.g. CT, MR) or a non-acquisition modality (e.g. segmentation, presentation state).

valueString.value: These codes are excerpted from Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) Standard, Part 16: Content Mapping Resource, Copyright 2011 by the National Electrical Manufacturers Association

description.value: Type of acquired data in the instance.

short.value: Imaging Selection purpose text or code

definition.value: Identifies the type of imaging selection.

requirements.value: Identifies the type of content and the structure of the imaging selection.

short.value: Who or what is the subject of the imaging selection

definition.value: The subject, typically a patient, of the imaging selection.

map.value: Patient ID (0010,0020) and Issuer of Patient ID (0010,0021) and / or Issuer of Patient ID Qualifiers Sequence (0010,0024) and / or Patient Name (0010,0010)

short.value: When the imaging selection was created

definition.value: Date and time the imaging selection was created.

short.value: Who performed imaging selection and what they did

definition.value: Indicates who or what performed the imaging selection and how they were involved.

map.value: One or more of: Performing Physician's Name (0008,1050) and Performing Physician Identification Sequence (0008,1052); Operators' Name (0008,1070) and Operator Identification Sequence (0008,1072); Manufacturer (0008,0070) and Manufacturer's Model Name (0008,1090); or Institution Name (0008,0080)

definition.value: Distinguishes the type of involvement of the performer in the imaging selection.

requirements.value: Allows disambiguation of the types of involvement of different performers.

description.value: The type of involvement of the performer.

map.value: PRF (Performing Physician's Name); SPRF (Operator's Name); DEV (Manufacturer / Manufacturer's Model Name); or LOC (Institution Name)

definition.value: Indicates who or what performed the imaging selection.

map.value: Practitioner (Performing Physician's Name); Practitioner (Operator's Name); Device (Manufacturer / Manufacturer's Model Name); or Organization (Institution Name)

definition.value: A plan or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this imaging selection.

requirements.value: Allows tracing of authorization for the imaging selection and tracking whether proposals/recommendations were acted upon. If the imaging selection is associated with an Accession Number, this field SHOULD include a reference to that value in the form: identifier.value = (Accession Number Value) identifier.type = ACSN. A reference value pointing to a ServiceRequest resource is allowed but is not required.

map.value: Accession Number (0080,0050) and Issuer of Accession Number Sequence (0080,0051)

short.value: The imaging study from which the imaging selection is derived

definition.value: The imaging study from which the imaging selection is made.
The Study Instance UID for the DICOM Study from which the images were selected.
The DICOM Series Instance UID of the selected series.

requirements.value: Must correspond to a Series that is part of the DICOM study identified by the `studyUid` element.

short.value: Numeric identifier of the selected series

definition.value: The numeric identifier of the selected series in the study.

requirements.value: Must correspond to the series identified by the `seriesUid` element.

short.value: The Frame of Reference UID for the selected images

definition.value: Identifier used to group composite instances that have the same coordinate system that conveys spatial and/or temporal information.

The anatomic structures selected. See [DICOM Part 16 Annex L](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part16/chapter_L.html) for DICOM to SNOMED-CT mappings. The bodySite MAY include the laterality of body part imaged.

valueString.value: Codes describing anatomical locations. MAY include laterality.

map.value: Body Part Examined (0018,0015) or Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218) and Laterality (0020,0060)

short.value: Related resources that are the focus for the imaging selection

definition.value: The actual focus of an imaging selection when it is another imaging selection resource and not the patient of record.

comment.value: An imaging selection MAY reference a DICOM resource that itself references other DICOM resources. e.g. a presentation state references a set of source images or frames.

short.value: The network services providing access for the subset of the study

definition.value: The network services providing access to the selected images, frames, etc. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints.
Each imaging selection includes one or more selected DICOM SOP instances.

requirements.value: If this element is not present and ImagingSelection.seriesUid is present, all instances in the specified series are included in the selection.

definition.value: The SOP Instance UID for the selected DICOM this image or other DICOM content.

requirements.value: DICOM SOP Instance UID. Must correspond to a SOP Instance that is part of the DICOM series identified by the `seriesUID` element.

short.value: The number of this instance in the series

definition.value: TThe number of the instance assigned by the creator of the series. MAY or MAY NOT correspond to intended display order.

comment.value: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.7.6.1](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.7.6.html#sect_C.7.6.1). Note: A multiframe instance has a single instance number with each frame identified by a frame number.

requirements.value: DICOM Instance Number. Must correspond to the SOP Instance identified by the `uid` element.

definition.value: DICOM instance type.
A list of frame numbers selected from a multiframe SOP Instance (See [DICOM PS 3.3 Table 10.3](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_10.3.html#table_10-3)).

requirements.value: Only allowed if the value of `instance.sopClass` corresponds to a multiframe SOP Class.

definition.value: A list of Referenced Content Item Identifier values selected from a DICOM SR or other structured document SOP Instance (See [DICOM PS 3.3 C.17.3.2.5](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.17.3.2.5.html)).

requirements.value: Only allowed if the value of `instance.sopClass` corresponds to a DICOM SR or other structured document SOP Class.

definition.value: A list of segment numbers selected from a segmentation SOP Instance (See [DICOM PS 3.3 Table C.8.20-4](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.8.20.4.html#table_C.8.20-4)).

requirements.value: Only allowed if the value of `instance.sopClass` corresponds to a segmentation SOP Class.

definition.value: A list of Region of Interest (ROI) numbers selected from a radiotherapy structure set SOP Instance (See [DICOM PS 3.3 C.8.8.5](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.8.8.5.html)).

requirements.value: Only allowed if the value of `instance.sopClass` corresponds to a radiotherapy structure set SOP Class.

definition.value: A list of channels in a Waveform selected from an instance of a waveform SOP Class. Each channel is specified as a pair of values where the first value is the Multiplex Group Number, and the second value is the Channel Number within the multiplex group (See [DICOM PS 3.3 C.18.5.1.1](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.18.5.html#sect_C.18.5.1.1)).

requirements.value: Only allowed if the value of `instance.sopClass` corresponds to a waveform structure set SOP Class.

definition.value: Specifies an image region, defined by a region type and a set of 2D coordinates in pixel space.

requirements.value: SHALL NOT be present if the parent imagingSelection.instance is not an image. If the parent imagingSelection.instance contains a subset element of type frame, the image region applies to all frames in the subset list.

definition.value: The type of image region.

short.value: The coordinates that define the image region

definition.value: The coordinates defining the image region. Encoded as a set of (column, row) pairs that denote positions in the selected image / frames specified with sub-pixel resolution. The origin at the TLHC of the TLHC pixel is 0.0\0.0, the BRHC of the TLHC pixel is 1.0\1.0, and the BRHC of the BRHC pixel is the number of columns\rows in the image / frames. The values SHALL be within the range 0\0 to the number of columns\rows in the image / frames.

comment.value: For a description of how 2D coordinates are encoded, see [DICOM PS 3.3 C.18.6](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.18.6.html).

requirements.value: The number of values SHALL be a multiple of two.

orderMeaning.value: The values are an ordered set of (x, y) coordinates.

short.value: A 3D region in a DICOM frame of reference

definition.value: Specifies a 3D image region, defined by a region type and a set of 3D coordinates.

requirements.value: The referenced 3D image region must be in the coordinate system identified by the `frameOfReferenceUid` element

short.value: point | multipoint | polyline | polygon | ellipse | ellipsoid

definition.value: Specifies the type of image region.

short.value: Specifies the coordinates that define the image region

definition.value: The coordinates defining the image region. Encoded as an ordered set of (x,y,z) triplets (in mm and MAY be negative) that define a region of interest in the patient-relative Reference Coordinate System defined by ImagingSelection.frameOfReferenceUid element.

comment.value: For a description of how 3D coordinates are encoded, see [DICOM PS3.3 C.18.9](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.18.9.html).

requirements.value: The number of values SHALL be a multiple of three.

orderMeaning.value: The values are an ordered set of (x, y, z) coordinates.
